Information Disclosure.description: An attacker can brute-force file encryption because there's no defense in place (example defense, password stretching).
Information Disclosure.OWASP ASVS: V2.1.4 Ensure password hashing with key stretching mechanism.

Information Disclosure.description: An attacker can see error messages with security sensitive content.
Information Disclosure.OWASP ASVS: V14.4 Ensure error handling does not expose sensitive information.

Information Disclosure.description: An attacker can read content because messages (say, an email or HTTP cookie) aren't encrypted even if the channel is encrypted.
Information Disclosure.OWASP ASVS: V9.1 Verify transport layer security for sensitive communications.

Information Disclosure.description: An attacker may be able to read a document or data because it's encrypted with a non-standard algorithm.
Information Disclosure.OWASP ASVS: V3.1 Verify the use of standard cryptographic algorithms.

Information Disclosure.description: An attacker can read data because it's hidden or occluded (for undo or change tracking) and the user might forget that it's there.
Information Disclosure.OWASP ASVS: V13.2 Verify that hidden fields and backup files are protected.

Information Disclosure.description: An attacker can act as a 'man in the middle' because you don't authenticate endpoints of a network connection.
Information Disclosure.OWASP ASVS: V10.11 Verify secure endpoint authentication.

Information Disclosure.description: An attacker can access information through a search indexer, logger, or other such mechanism.
Information Disclosure.OWASP ASVS: V6.4 Ensure data access via system components is controlled.

Information Disclosure.description: An attacker can read sensitive information in a file with permissive permissions.
Information Disclosure.OWASP ASVS: V13.3 Verify file permissions to protect sensitive data.

Information Disclosure.description: An attacker can read information in files or databases with no access controls.
Information Disclosure.OWASP ASVS: V4.1 Ensure minimal access to resources.

Information Disclosure.description: An attacker can discover the fixed key being used to encrypt.
Information Disclosure.OWASP ASVS: V2.2 Ensure encryption keys are managed securely.

Information Disclosure.description: An attacker can read the entire channel because the channel (say, HTTP or SMTP) isn't encrypted.
Information Disclosure.OWASP ASVS: V9.3 Verify the use of encryption for data channels.

Information Disclosure.description: An attacker can read network information because there's no cryptography used.
Information Disclosure.OWASP ASVS: V2.3 Verify that encryption is used in data transmission.

Information Disclosure.description: An attacker decrypts sensitive data transmitted over an insecure legacy protocol due to lack of proper encryption.
Information Disclosure.OWASP ASVS: V9.1 Ensure that older protocols have encryption upgraded.

Information Disclosure.description: An attacker extracts sensitive information through error messages generated by an SQL injection vulnerability.
Information Disclosure.OWASP ASVS: V14.5 Prevent error messages from revealing details about the backend.

Information Disclosure.description: An attacker accesses configuration files containing sensitive data due to improper access controls on a cloud storage bucket.
Information Disclosure.MITRE ATT&CK: T1530 - Data from Cloud Storage Object
Information Disclosure.OWASP ASVS: V13.2 Ensure storage buckets are configured to deny unauthorized access.

Information Disclosure.description: Sensitive data is leaked via metadata in document headers which are not stripped from documents before public release.
Information Disclosure.OWASP ASVS: V13.5 Ensure metadata is cleaned from publicly shared files.

Information Disclosure.description: An attacker sniffs network traffic to read unencrypted data being transmitted between the client and the server.
Information Disclosure.OWASP ASVS: V2.3 Verify all data transmissions are encrypted with up-to-date standards.

Information Disclosure.description: An attacker utilizes directory listing vulnerabilities to discover and access unprotected files and directories on a web server.
Information Disclosure.OWASP ASVS: V5.4 Verify directory listing is disabled on the server.

Information Disclosure.description: A developer unintentionally logs sensitive information, such as passwords or API keys, in debug logs that are not secured.
Information Disclosure.OWASP ASVS: V7.4 Ensure debug logs do not contain sensitive information.

Information Disclosure.description: An attacker takes advantage of a weakly implemented CAPTCHA allowing automated tools to scrape sensitive user data from the site.
Information Disclosure.OWASP ASVS: V16.5 Verify CAPTCHAs are effectively protecting against automated data harvesting.

Information Disclosure.description: Sensitive data is exposed to external systems through verbose HTTP referrer headers sent by the browser.
Information Disclosure.OWASP ASVS: V12.3 Ensure HTTP referrer headers do not expose sensitive paths.

Information Disclosure.description: An attacker manipulates client-side caching mechanisms to retrieve sensitive information stored in cache files.
Information Disclosure.MITRE ATT&CK: T1552.004 - Unsecured Credentials in Local Storage
Information Disclosure.OWASP ASVS: V13.13 Verify secure handling and storage of cache data.
